translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor
One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor
Name of the true Guru is the truth, knowable only becoming gurmukh, the Guru orientated.
The holy congregation is the only place where sabad-brahm,

gurmukhi: drgh scu inAwau jl duDu CwxIAY
transliteration: Daragah Sachu Niaau Jal Dudhu Chhaaneeai.
translation: The true justice is done and water is sifted from milk.
Surrender before the Guru is the safest shelter, where through service (the merit) is earned.

gurmukhi: sbd suriq suix gwau AMdir AwxIAY
transliteration: Sabad Surati Souni Gaau Andari Aaneeai.
translation: Here, with full attention the Word is listened to, sung and embedded in the heart.
I am sacrifice unto such a Guru who bestows honour to the humble and the lowly.
Congregation of the Sikhs of the Guru

gurmukhi: cwir vrn gur isK sMgiq Awvxw
transliteration: Chaari Varan Gur Sikh Sangati Aavanaa.
translation: In the congregation of the Sikhs of the Guru, the people of all the varnas assemble.

gurmukhi: gurmuiK mwrgu ivKu AMqu n pwvxw
transliteration: Guramoukhi Maaragu Vikhu Antu N Paavanaa.
translation: The way of the gurmukhs is difficult and its mystery cannot be understood.

gurmukhi: quil n AMmiRq ieK kIrqnu gwvxw
transliteration: Tuli N Anmrit Ikh Keeratanu Gaavanaa.
translation: Even the sweet juice of sugarcane cannot be compared with the delight of kirtan, the melodious recitation of hymns.
Here, the seeker gets all the four ideals of life i.e., dharma, arth, kam and moks.
Those who have cultivated the Word, have merged in the Lord and have liberated themselves from all the accounts.

gurmukhi: suJin BUq BivK n Awpu jxwvxw ]2]
transliteration: Sujhani Bhoot Bhavikh N Aapu Janaavanaa ?2?
translation: They see through all the ages and yet do not put themselves above others.
Sight of unapproachable
I bow before the eternal Lord who by his own grace shows his invisible form (in all the creatures).
He gracefully makes the unstruck melody enter into the unchiselled mind and refines it.
He, in the company of the saints, makes one drink the nectar, which otherwise is not easy to digest.
Those who have received the teachings of the perfect, remain steadfast on truth.

gurmukhi: gurmuiK BUpiq vyis n ivAwpY mwieAw
transliteration: Guramoukhi Bhoopati Vaysi N Viaapai Maaiaa.
translation: In fact, the gurmukhs are the kings but they remain away from maya.

gurmukhi: bHmy ibsn mhys n drsnu pwieAw ]3]
transliteration: Brahamay Bisan Mahays N Darasanu Paaiaa ?3?
translation: Brahma, Visnu and Mahesa cannot have the sight of the Lord (but the gurmukhs have the same)
Brahma,Visnu,Mahesa
Visnu incarnated ten times and established his names.

gurmukhi: kir kir Asur sMGwr vwdu vDwieAw
transliteration: Kari Kari Asur Sanghaar Vaadu Vadhaaiaa.
translation: Destroying the demons he increased the conflicts.
Brahma thoughtfully recited the four Vedas;
But created the universe out of his ego.
Siva being engrossed in tamas always remained vexed and angry.
Only gurmukhs, the Guru orientated, forswearing their ego reach the door of liberation.
Even being an ascetic, Narad merely talked (of here and there).
Sanak and Sukdev et al.
Being a backbiter, he popularised himself only as a tell-tale.
Sanak et al. got angry when they having gone to Visnu were not allowed entry by the doorkeepers.
They forced Visnu to undergo ten incarnations and thus the peaceful life of Visnu got tormented.

gurmukhi: ijin suk jixAw mwie duKu shwieAw
transliteration: Jini Souku Baniaa Maai Doukhu Sahaaiaa.
translation: The mother who gave birth to Sukdev was caused to suffer by him by remaining undelivered by the mother for twelve years.

gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Pl Kwie Ajru jrwieAw ]5]
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phal Khaai Ajaru Jaraaiaa ?5?
translation: Only gurmukhs tasting the fruit of supreme joy have endured the unendurable (name of the Lord).
The Earth

gurmukhi: DrqI nIvI hoie crx icqu lwieAw
transliteration: Dharatee Neeveen Hoi Charan Chitu Laaiaa.
translation: The earth becoming lowly concentrated on the feet (of Lord).

gurmukhi: crx kvl rsu Boie Awpu gvwieAw
transliteration: Charan Kaval Rasu Bhoi Aapu Gavaaiaa.
translation: Being one with the joy of the lotus feet, it divested itself of the ego.

gurmukhi: crx ryxu iqhu loie ieC ieCwieAw
transliteration: Charan Raynu Tihu Loi Ichh Ichhaaiaa.
translation: It is that dust of the feet, which is desired by the three worlds.
Fortitude and dutifulness added to it, the contentment is the basis of all.
It, considering the way of life of every creature, offers livelihood to all.
In accordance to the divine will, it behaves like a gurmukh does.
Water

gurmukhi: pwxI DrqI ivic Driq ivic pwxIAY
transliteration: Paanee Dharatee Vichi Dharati Vichi Paaneeai.
translation: The water is in the earth and the earth in the water.

gurmukhi: nIchu nIc n ihc inrml jwxIAY
transliteration: Neechahu Neech N Hich Niramal Jaaneeai.
translation: Water has no hesitation in going low and lower; it is rather considered more pure.
To flow down, water bears the concussion of the gravitational force but still likes to go lower.

gurmukhi: mn mylI Gul imic sB rMg mwxIAY
transliteration: Man Maylee Ghul Mich Sabh Rang Maaneeai.
translation: It absorbs in everybody and enjoys with one and all.
Meeting once it does not go apart and hence it is acceptable in the court of the Lord.
The devoted persons (bhagats) are identified through their service (to the mankind)
Trees
The tree on the earth has their heads down towards the bottom.
They endure suffering themselves but pour happiness on the world.

gurmukhi: Pl dy lwhin BuK vt vgwieAw
transliteration: Phal Day Laahani Bhoukh Vat Vagaaiaa.
translation: Even on being stoned, they offer fruits and quench our hunger.

gurmukhi: Cwv GxI bih suK mnu prcwieAw
transliteration: Chhaav Ghanee Bahi Soukh Manu Parachaaiaa.
translation: Their shadow is so thick that the mind (and body) enjoys peace.
If someone cuts them, they offer to be sawed.
Rare are the persons like tree who accept the will of Lord.
Other gifts of the trees
From tree are made houses and pillars.
A tree getting sawed helps to make boat.
Then adding iron (nails) to it, it gets people float on water.
In spite of the myriads of waves of river, it takes people across.
Likewise, the Sikhs of the Guru, in love and fear of the Lord, practise the Word.
They make people follow the one Lord and get them liberated from the bondages of transmigration.
Examples of sesame seed
Sesame gets crushed in the oil press and gives oil.
The oil burns in the lamp and the darkness is dispelled.
The soot of the lamp becomes ink and the same oil reaches the ink-pot with whose help is written the Word of the Guru.

gurmukhi: suix isiK iliK ilKwie AlyK suxwieAw
transliteration: Souni Sikhi Likhi Likhaai Alaykhu Sounaaiaa.
translation: By listening to, writing, learning and getting written the words, the imperceptible Lord is eulogised.
The gurmukhs, losing their sense of ego, practise the Word.

transliteration: Giaan Anjan Liv Laai Sahaji Samaaiaa ?10?
translation: And using the collyrium of knowledge and concentration immerses in equanimity.
Animal is better than a Manmukh, the mind=oriented

gurmukhi: duDu dyie KVu Kwie n Awpu gxwieAw
transliteration: Dudhu Dayi Kharhu Khaai N Aapu Ganaaiaa.
translation: Standing into a pit they yield milk and do not pose to be counted, i.e. the animals do not have the ego.
Milk is converted into curd and the butter comes thereof.
With their dung and urine, the earth is plastered to offer worship;
But while eating variety of goods man turns them into abominable faeces, useless for any purpose.
Those who have worshipped Lord in the holy congregation, their life is blessed and successful.

gurmukhi: sPl jnmu jig Awie suK Pl pwieAw ]11]
transliteration: Saphal Janamu Jagi Aai Soukh Phal Paaiaa ?11?
translation: Only they get the fruit of life on earth.
Gurmukhs tolerate sufferings like cotton
Accepting the will of the Lord, cotton suffers a lot.
Having been ginned through the roller, it is carded.
Having carded it, its yarn is spun.
Then the weaver with the help of his reed, eaves it into cloth.
The washerman puts that cloth into his boiling cauldron and then washes it on a stream.
Putting on the same clothes, the rich and the kings adorn the assemblies.
Gurmukhs keep busy in service
Madder (Rubia munjista) knowing very well gets itself grinded.

gurmukhi: kdy n CfY sMgu bxq bxwieAw
transliteration: Kaday N Chhaday Sangu Banat Banaaiaa.
translation: Its character is such that it never deserts the clothes.
Likewise, the sugarcane also care freely gets itself crushed.

gurmukhi: krY n mn rs BMgu AimE cuAwieAw
transliteration: Karai N Man Ras Bhangu Amiao Chuaaiaa.
translation: Without leaving away its sweetness offers the taste of nectar.

gurmukhi: guVu skr KMf AcMgu Bog BugwieAw
transliteration: Gurhu Sakar Khand Achangu Bhog Bhougaaiaa.
translation: It produces jaggery, sugar, treacle molasses many relishable items.

gurmukhi: swD n moVn AMgu jgu prcwieAw ]13]
transliteration: Saadh N Morhan Angu Jagu Parachaaiaa ?13?
translation: Similarly, the saints also do not abstain from the service of mankind, and give happiness to all.
By deleting of ego, like iron, one sees the self
Putting iron into the furnance the iron is heated.
Then it is put on the anvil where it bears the strokes of hammer.
Making it clear like glass, its value is set.
Grinding against whet stones its parts are pruned i.e. many articles are made out of it.
Now keeping it (or those articles) in the saw-dust etc. it is left for getting clean.
Similarly the gurmukhs by losing their ego come face to face with their own basic nature.
Example of rebeck
A handsome tree got cut itself and got manufactured into a rebeck.
A young goat underwent the mortification of getting killed itself; it distributed its meat among the meat-eaters.
Its intestines were made into gut and the skin was mounted (on drum) and stitched.
Now it is brought in the holy congregation where melody is produced on this instrument.
It creates the melody of Raag as the Shabad is heard.
Any one who worships true Guru, the God, gets absorbed into the equanimity.
Sandal tree

transliteration: Channanu Roukhu Oupaai Van Khandi Rakhiaa.
translation: God created the sandal tree and kept it in the forest.

gurmukhi: pvxu gvxu kir jwie AlKu n liKAw
transliteration: Pavanu Gavanu Kari Jaai Alakhu N Lakhiaa.
translation: The breeze moves around the sandal but does not understand the imperceptible (nature of the tree).
The truth about the sandal comes to the forefront when it perfumes everyone with its fragrance.
The gurmukh goes beyond all the caste and the distinctions of eating taboos.

gurmukhi: swDsMgiq BY Bwie AipE pI ciKAw
transliteration: Saadhasangati Bhai Bhaai Apiu Pee Chakhiaa.
translation: He drinks the nectar of fear and love of the Lord in the holy congregation.
The Gurmukh comes face to face with his own intrinsic nature (sahaj subhai).
Service of the Gursikh
Within the teaching of the Guru, the Sikhs of the Guru serve (others).
They give in charity the four riches (char padarathi) to the beggars.
They sing paeans of the invisible Lord who is beyond all accounts.

gurmukhi: Bwie Bgiq rsu ieK Aimau cuAwvxI
transliteration: Bhaai Bhagati Ras Ikh Amiu Chuaavanee.
translation: They drink the juice of the sugarcane of loving devotion, and make others also enjoy the same.

gurmukhi: quil n BUq BivK n kImiq pwvxI
transliteration: Tuli N Bhoot Bhavikh N Keemati Paavanee.
translation: Nothing in the past as well as the future can be equal to their love.

gurmukhi: gurmuiK mwrg ivK lvY n lwvxI ]17]
transliteration: Guramoukhi Maarag Vikh Lavai N Laavanee ?17?
translation: None can vie with even the one step of the way of gurmukhs.
Fruits of the service of Gursikhs

gurmukhi: ieMdR purI lK rwj nIr BrwvxI
transliteration: Indr Puree Lakh Raaj Neer Bharaavanee.
translation: Fetching water for the holy congregation is equal to the kingdom of lacs of Indrapuris.
Grinding of corn (for the holy congregation) is more than the pleasure of myriads of heavens.

gurmukhi: iriD isiD inD lK swj cuil JukwvxI
transliteration: Ridhi Sidhi Nidhi Lakh Saaj Chuli Jhoukaavanee.
translation: Arranging for and putting in woods into the hearth of langar (free kitchen) for the congregation is equal to the rddhis, siddhis and the nine treasures.
The holy persons are the caretakers of the poor and in their company the humility resides in the heart (of people).
Singing of hymns of the Guru is the personification of the unstruck melody.
Fruits of the service

gurmukhi: hom jg lK Bog cxy cbwvxI
transliteration: Hom Jag Lakh Bhog Chanay Chabaavanee.
translation: To feed a Sikh with parched gram is superior to hundreds of thousands of burnt offerings and feasts.
To cause his to be washed is superior to visits to assemblages at the places of pilgrimages.

gurmukhi: igAwn iDAwn lK jog sbd sunwvxI
transliteration: Giaan Dhiaan Lakh Jog Sabadu Sounaavanee.
translation: To repeat to a Sikh of the Gurus hymns is equal to a hundred thousands of other religious exercises.

gurmukhi: rhY n shsw sog JwqI pwvxI
transliteration: Rahai N Sahasaa Sog Jhaatee Paavanee.
translation: Even the glimpse of the Guru dispels all doubts and regrets.

gurmukhi: Baujl ivic Arog n lhir frwvxI
transliteration: Bhaujal Vichi Arog N Lahari Daraavanee.
translation: Such a man remains unscathed in the terrible world ocean and does not fear its waves.
He whom embraces the Gurus religion (Gurmati) has past beyond the bounds of joy or grief for gain or loss.
Infinite Fruits of service
As the seed puts in the earth gives fruit thousand times more.

gurmukhi: gurisK muiK pvwie n lyK ilKwieAw
transliteration: Gurasikh Moukhi Pavaai N Laykh Likhaaiaa.
translation: The food put in the mouth of a gurmukh multiplies infinitely and its count becomes impossible.

gurmukhi: DrqI dyie Plwie joeI Plu pwieAw
transliteration: Dharatee Dayi Phalaai Joee Phalu Paaiaa.
translation: The earth gives the fruit of the seed sowed in it;

gurmukhi: gurisK muiK smwie sB Pl lwieAw
transliteration: Gurasikh Moukhi Samaai Sabh Phal Laaiaa.
translation: But the seed it offered to Guru oriented ones gives all sorts of fruits.

gurmukhi: bIjy bwJu n Kwie n Driq jmwieAw
transliteration: Beejay Baajhu N Khaai N Dharati Jamaaiaa.
translation: Without sowing, neither anyone could eat anything nor the earth can produce anything;
Having the desire of serve the Gurmukh, fulfils all desires.

gurmukhi: pRym rs bis huie pqMg sMgm n jwnY ibrh ibCoh mIn huie n mir jwny hY
transliteration: Praym Ras Basi Hui Patang Sangam N Jaanai , Birah Bichhoh Meen Hui N Mari Jaanay Hai ?
translation: In order to become one with my dear beloved, I, a deceitful lover, not possessed by his love, did not learn from a mot how to die in separation from him, nor did I learn from fish how to die in the separation of beloved.

gurmukhi: drs iDAwn joiq mY n huie joqI srUp crn ibmuK hoie pRwn Thrwny hY
transliteration: Daras Dhiaan Joti Mai N Hui Jotee Saroopa , Charan Bimoukh Hoi Praan Tthaharaanay Hai ?
translation: And here I am who is not making any effort to merge in my Lord by keeping his refulgence in my heart; and yet with all this recalcitrance, I am alive.

gurmukhi: imil ibCrq giq pRym n ibrh jwnI mIn Aau pqMg moih dyKq ljwny hY
transliteration: Mili Bichharat Gati Praym N Birah Jaanee , Meen Au Patang Mohi Daykhat Lajaanay Hai ?
translation: I have not understood the intensity of love and consequence of death as is in the case of a moth and flame or fish and water, and therefore both moth and fish feel ashamed of my; fraudulent love.

gurmukhi: mwns jnm DiRgu DMin hY qiRgd join kpt snyh dyh nrk n mwny hY ]14]
transliteration: Maanas Janam Dhrigu Dhanni Hai Trigad Joni , Kapat Sanayh Dayh Narak N Maanay Hai ?14?
translation: Being a deceitful friend, my human life is damnable, whereas the reptilian species are worth appreciation for their love of their beloveds like the moth and fish. Because of my fraudulent love I will not even get a place in hell. (14)
